mcqs.question: How does the Lucas-Kanade method address the aperture problem?

options.A: By ensuring gradients exist in two separate directions
options.B: By relying on priors about the motion field
options.C: By applying a Gaussian filter to smooth the motion vectors
options.D: By tracking edges and corners within an aperture
options.E: By normalizing the image intensity across the aperture

mcqs.question: What is the essential difference between direct and feature-based motion estimation methods?

options.A: Direct methods compare pixel values, while feature-based methods track visual features
options.B: Direct methods assess motion through gradient descent, while feature-based methods use correlation tracking
options.C: Direct methods use optical flow, while feature-based methods rely on motion capture technology
options.D: Direct methods use edge detection, while feature-based methods use texture analysis
options.E: Direct methods utilize color segmentation, while feature-based methods use shape matching

mcqs.question: What is an advantage and disadvantage of the Lucas-Kanade method compared to feature matching?

options.A: Advantage: More effective for real-time applications. Disadvantage: More likely to fail with textured surfaces
options.B: Advantage: Can handle larger motions. Disadvantage: Computationally more expensive
options.C: Advantage: Computationally more efficient. Disadvantage: More likely to struggle with large motions
options.D: Advantage: More robust to noise. Disadvantage: More sensitive to lighting changes
options.E: Advantage: More accurate in dense areas. Disadvantage: Worse performance in sparse areas

mcqs.question: Based on the lecture material, what do smoothness of location and smoothness of velocity mean in point tracking?

options.A: Smoothness of location signifies that the object cannot be in multiple places at the same time, whereas smoothness of velocity means that the object’s speed is limited to linear changes
options.B: Smoothness of location means the object remains in a particular region of the image, while smoothness of velocity means the object retains a particular speed range
options.C: Smoothness of location pertains to maintaining a constant magnitude of motion, while smoothness of velocity tries to enforce linear motion
options.D: Smoothness of location means small directional changes, while smoothness of velocity means consistent speed between frames
options.E: Smoothness of location is about maintaining a constant distance from a reference point, while smoothness of velocity deals with uniform motion

mcqs.question: Why do we need the small motion assumption when using the optical flow equation?

options.A: Small motion reduces the computational complexity of the optical flow algorithms
options.B: Optical flow equation is inherently biased against large motions
options.C: Small motion allows the first-order Taylor expansion to remain valid
options.D: Small motion is necessary to avoid aliasing effects in the optical flow computation
options.E: Small motion ensures that the time derivative of the image intensity remains constant

mcqs.question: What is the aperture problem in motion analysis?

options.A: The issue of identifying objects when they overlap in a frame
options.B: The difficulty in distinguishing between moving objects and background noise
options.C: The inability to determine true motion direction from an edge
options.D: The inability to detect motion in low-light conditions
options.E: The problem of tracking multiple moving objects simultaneously

mcqs.question: How does the human visual system deal with the aperture problem?

options.A: It uses the motion of surrounding objects to infer direction
options.B: It relies on depth cues to solve the problem
options.C: It uses color cues within the aperture to infer motion direction
options.E: It compensates using priors based on the aperture's shape

mcqs.question: What is the difference between a motion vector and a motion field?

options.A: Motion vector indicates speed, while motion field indicates velocity
options.B: Motion field represents the magnitude, while motion vector represents the direction
options.C: Motion vector is a vector quantity, while motion field is a scalar quantity
options.D: Both terms are interchangeable in motion analysis
options.E: Motion vector represents a single point, while a motion field represents multiple points

mcqs.question: What is the relationship between perceived motion and depth?

options.A: The magnitude of motion is directly proportional to depth
options.B: The magnitude of motion is inversely proportional to depth
options.D: The direction of motion is inversely proportional to depth
options.E: Perceived motion is perpendicular to depth

mcqs.question: What is the difference between apparent motion and actual motion?

options.A: Apparent motion refers to movement caused by optical illusions, whereas actual motion is movement physically occurring in space
options.B: Apparent motion is influenced by the observer's frame of reference, while actual motion is absolute and unchanging
options.C: Apparent motion occurs under constant lighting conditions, whereas actual motion can be observed under varying lighting conditions
options.D: Apparent motion is perceived movement in the image, while actual motion is true physical movement
options.E: Apparent motion can only be perceived in two dimensions, whereas actual motion occurs in three dimensions
